description: From French burin. Doublet of boline.

entries.meaning: A chisel with a sharp point, used for engraving; a graver.
examples: I kept staring at the same wallpaper on the same wall; I stared at it so often that every line of its zigzag pattern has etched itself on the innermost folds of my brain as if with an engraverâ€™s burin.
